texts.es: Judith es una mujer dedicada a la enseñanza principalmente   de niños, ya que su profesión es  maestra de educación primaria,  con 2 años  de desempeñarse como docente, es  casada,  con 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, a quienes les da todo el apoyo para su desarrollo ,actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, por eso visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de Bloques, hierro, cemento, perlin, taza, arena y mano de obra, la que le brindara mejores condiciones en su vivienda
texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking woman who has been an elementary school teacher for two years now. She is dedicated to her students and to their personal and academic growth. Judith is married and has two young children who depend on her and whom she loves very much.

Judith's family's house is in need of repairs, and she is requesting this loan in hopes of making improvements to her home. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase building materials, including: cement blocks, iron, cement, sand, corrugated metal roof slabs and manual labor costs. Judith hopes that this investment will help improve her family's safety and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement blocks, iron, cement, sand, corrugated metal roof slabs and manual labor costs in order to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Shahla

texts.en:
Shahla is a 36 years-old married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Shahla’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. 

For this reason, Shahla applied for a loan of Rs 50,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with a new CNG kit. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shahla is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown a good repayment history. Shahla is hopeful that this new loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with a new CNG kit.

loans.name: Odalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
El señora Odalia es  una mujer emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación,  y maestra de educación la cual tiene 21 años  de ejercer su profesión como Docente de primaria, actualmente mantiene el mercado establecido, como otra alternativa económica es venta de ropa de damas y caballeros,  es casado con 3 hijos a los que le brinda el apoyo incondicional como madre.
Actualmente este señora tiene la necesidad de  incrementar su inventario para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ya que tiene un mercado establecido, por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de pantalones, camisas, camisolas para hombre y mujer,  el cual le vendrá a incrementar y estabilizar sus negocio e  ingresos  y de esa  manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Odalia is an enterprising woman who has a strong desire to succeed.  She is a teacher who has been teaching at the elementary level for 21 years.  She also has a business selling clothing for men and women that is established in the marketplace.  She is married and has 3 children, to whom she provides unconditional support as a mother.

At this time, she needs to increase her inventory so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers, because she already has established herself in the market.  To do this, she visited CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy pants, shirts, and sports shirts for men and women which she will sell to increase her sales and stabilize her business and income.  In this way, she will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and sports shirts for men and women to increase her inventory

loans.name: Silvia Alejandra

texts.es: La señora Silvia habita en el municiipio de Masaya junto a su esposo e hijos, uno de sus mayores sueños es poder terminar de construir su casa, y que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones de vida, su esposo la apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que es taxista, ella por su parte tiene un negocio de costura pero eso no le alcanza para las construciones que desean realizar, con este credito comprara: Bloques, Cemento, Arena. etc, para hacer un pequeño cuarto, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in the town of Masaya with her husband and children. One of her dreams is to finish the construction of her family's home so that her children can live in better conditions. Both Silvia and her husband help with household expenses. Her husband is a taxi driver, and Silvia has a sewing workshop, but their combined income is not enough to cover the cost of construction materials for this project on their home.

In hopes of improving her family's safety and quality of life by adding a room to their home, Silvia is requesting this loan. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase building materials, including: cement blocks, cement, sand, etc. Silvia is very grateful for the support she has received and for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase building materials in order to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena trabaja como confeccionista de mantas y chalinas de vicuña en su propio domicilio ubicado en la zona Villa Esperanza en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive con sus dos hijas.
 
El crédito es para comprar lanas de vicuña. Así podrá  confeccionar más sus productos  y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida

El sueño de Filomena, es mejorar sus ingresos.

Es la Segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Filomena works making blankets and scarves out of vicuña wool.  She works in her own home, located in the Villa Esperanza neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  She lives with her 2 daughters.

This loan will be used to buy vicuña wool.  This way she can make more products, allowing her to improve her quality of life.

Filomena's dream is to increase her income.

This is the second time that Filomena has requested a loan with IMPRO, and the second time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool for her business

loans.name: Zanib

texts.en:
At the age of 39, Zanib is an energetic married woman. She has a business of hand-embroidery. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her locality and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of 5 children and wants to grow her business. 

She requested a loan of Rs 25,000, to buy raw materials such as threads in various colors with packs of sequins, stones and pearls in large quantities. It would help her to complete orders for her customers on time. She wishes to use the profits for her children’s well-being and education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads in various colors with packs of sequins, stones and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El Sr. German tiene 37 años, está acompañado con la Sra. Carolina de 35 años, ellos tienen la dicha de tener una hija, por quienes ambos se esfuerzan y dan todo, ya que quieren que el día de mañana sea una persona de bien y que no tenga que pasar por necesidades.
Don German se inició en la profesión de constructor  hace más de  15 años, aproximadamente desde el año: 1.998, Él comenzó desde muy temprana edad a trabajar con su papá, donde aprendió de todo para esta profesión, como para que ahora pueda ser el encargado, y poder dirigir a 30 personas construyendo  obras, en la actualidad tiene 3 obras en construcción, y cada vez más la gente lo considera y genera contactos para próximos trabajo e ingreso para él, por la calidad de lo que realiza.
 Este crédito le servirá para comprar más cemento, varillas, arena lavada, etc, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. German is 37 years old and married to Sra. Carolina, age 35. They have a daughter, so both of them strive to give her everything so that she can be a successful person in the future and have all of her needs met.

Don German started his profession as a builder more than 15 years ago, around 1998. He begins his work very early alongside his father, who is responsible for teaching everything he knows about this trade. As a result, he now manages 30 people and is currently in the middle of three construction projects. With each new project, he is gaining more contacts that will lead to additional work and more income. He is known for doing quality work.

This loan will be used to buy more cement, metal rods, washed sand, and other supplies so that he can continue working and satisfying his customers.

loans.use: to buy cement, metal rods, washed sand, and other construction supplies.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora  María es una mujer  visionaria, su actividad económica la efectúa atravez de la profesión como maestra de educación primaria,  con  24 años de laborar  como maestra, es soltera con 3 personas a su cargo a las que les brinda su apoyo para su desarrollo.
Actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda la que está en mal estado, por eso se decidió visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de inodoro, ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y zinc y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking, visionary woman who has been investing in her community as an elementary school teacher for the past 24 years. She is a single mother to three young children whom she loves very much.

With her home in serious need of repairs, María is requesting this loan. She plans to use the support from the loan to purchase building materials, including: a toilet, bricks, cement, sand, iron, zinc, etc. She hopes this investment will help her to improve her family's living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a toilet, bricks, cement, sand, iron, zinc and other building materials for making improvements to her home.

loans.name: Hilma

texts.es: Hilma tiene 43 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hilma se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como maquillajes, tintes, perfumes y otros. Asegura que se diferencia de otras vendedoras de su sector por el trato amable y cordial que ella siempre tiene hacia sus clientes. Se inició en esta actividad hace 5 años y hasta el momento lo realiza sola, tanto en la venta como en la cobranza de los créditos. Ahora  se siente una empresaria próspera e independiente. Espera continuar su negocio y poco a poco implementar un espacio en su casa para que pueda exhibir todo lo que tiene para ofrecer. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará mercaderías para aumentar su stock de perfumería disponible para la venta como cremas corporales, cremas faciales y perfumes.
texts.en:
Hilma is 43 years old, and she lives with her husband and three children. She makes a living selling healthy and beauty products, such as makeup, hair dyes, perfumes and many other products. Hilma stands out from other cosmetic salespeople in her area because she always treats her clients with the utmost respect and kindness. Hilma started her business five years ago and has operated it on her own since then.

As an independent, experienced businesswoman, Hilma hopes to continue growing her business and to eventually dedicate a specific space in her home from which she can run her operation and showcase her products. She is grateful for the opportunity of this loan, and plans to use the support from the loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business, including: body lotions, face creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, creams and perfumes for her health and beauty business.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy, a parent of two schoolchildren residing in Battambang province, is in her early 30s and is a farmer in the local area. The main icome source of her family is from rice growing and grocery items selling. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years, earning about 28,000 KHR per day. 

Sophy, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past five cycles, has fully repaid her past loans which have improved her living conditions in a gradual manner. Now, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale. Additionally, she will use some of her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing. She hopes that she can gain a high yield and attract more clients for her grocery-selling business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a loving mother of four children. She enjoys her business of hand embroidery with the support of her husband. She has built a successful business through all her hard work. She has in-depth knowledge of good quality embroidery patterns and her client demand is strong. She earns enough for a hand-to-mouth existence. 

In order to expand her business, she requested a 20,000 PKR loan to buy raw materials including threads in various colors, with some packs of beads and sequins. In this way, she would be able to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including threads in various colors, and some packs of beads and sequins.

loans.name: Erick Manuel

texts.es: Erick Manuel 32 años casado con tres hijos menores de edad, originario de una de las comarcas de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, el se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable con deseos de superación tanto en lo personal como en lo laboral, Erick disfruta sus ratos libres con su familia especialmente con sus hijos en salidas como llevándolos al parque, al cine y pasar la mayor parte del tiempo con ellos ya que su trabajo no le permite pasar con ellos como el quisiera debido a su trabajo que es la venta de mercadería en general como: ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos cuadros entre otros compras que realizar en Managua y a comerciantes al por mayor, Erick tiene cliente fijos y eventuales sus ventas son al contado y al crédito las cuales las recupera semanal y quincenal, El desde  muy temprano empieza su jornada de trabajo las cuales son aproximadamente unas 10 horas cargando mercadería y a la misma vez recuperando sus cuentas por cobrar y levantando nuevos pedidos, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo incrementando su inventario de mercadería, la cual en este momento todo lo tiene distribuido por lo que tiene que comprar nuevamente más mercadería.
texts.en:
Erick Manuel is 32 years old and has three young children. He is from the western region of Chinandega, and he is a very hardworking, responsible man with great professional and personal goals. Erick Manuel loves spending his free time with his family and taking them out to the park or the movies whenever his work will let him. He operates a general store where he sells a wide variety of products, including: clothing, shoes, cosmetics, plastic products and other items. He buys his merchandise in bulk in Managua and sells it in his town.

Erick has worked hard to build up his customer base, and he works with his clients to make sales in cash or on credit, depending on their needs. He works long hours, and on days when he stocks up on merchandise, he will spend 10 hours loading merchandise along with managing sales and taking new orders. With the support from this loan, Erick plans to purchase purchase merchandise to stock his business, since he is almost out of products due to a high number of sales and orders.

loans.use: to purchase adult and children's clothing, shoes, plastic products, cosmetics and other items to stock his business.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: Isa is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now, he lives in the Baku region with his family. Isa is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children. His daughter is 4 years old, and his son is 2 years old. Isa started his construction business 2 years ago. Now, Isa needs a loan of 2,300 AZN to buy apparatus and implements. He wants to use the money for his children's future. In the future, Isa wants to have his own workshop team. This will be more profitable for his business. Isa is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy apparatus and implements for his construction business.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en: Asmat, 54, sells animals. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has a good approach towards business expansion and savings for the future. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She is a dedicated mother of four; she needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 35-year-old married woman. She works from home as a tailor and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When she was not earning, her family went through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family, and due to limited resources none of their children were sent to school. Farhat felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. 

Her hard work has helped her establish a good client list, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. So she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 20,000. This loan amount will help her to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in different colors that will enable her to stitch up more of her customers' dresses without fail.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Tayyar

texts.en:
Tayyar is a 46-year-old married father of six children. He owns a small farm where he plants and harvests all sorts of plants and vegetables, which he sells for a living. His wife is currently unemployed, which means that the farm is their only source of financial support. 

Tayyar decided to contact Al Majmoua because he needs to maximize his profit in order to provide a healthy life for his family. In fact, he will be using the loan in order to purchase seeds and raw materials that would help him improve and enhance his output. As for the future, Tayyar wishes to expand the farm.

His previous Kiva loan developed his socio-economic life a lot.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and raw materials to improve and enhance his output

loans.name: Venceremos Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Venceremos por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres responsables, con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estas personas son originarias de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos. Y compartir tiempo de calidad. Estas personas luchan, día a día para sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ellos no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.
Benita es la coordinadora del banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería que está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que tiene por actividades económica la venta de productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como caja de  arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, caja de fósforos, sobre se shampoo, detergente, jabón, jugos, pan, leche, huevos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que las desempeña con mucho gusto. El banco comunal Venceremos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas  escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Community Bank, "Venceremos," (Overcome), is made up of eight members - seven women and one man. All the members are responsible parents, with a collective 15 children in their care. All the group members are from the town of León, which is located in the western region of Nicaragua. In their free time, the group members like to spend quality time with their families. Even though none of the group members were able to complete higher education degrees, they work as hard as they can every day to provide for their families and give their children a bright future.

Benita is the group coordinator, and she makes a living operating a small general store out of her home. She sells small quantities of a wide variety of products, including: rice, sugar, beans, corn, matches, shampoo, detergents, soap, juices, bread, milk, eggs, etc. She hopes to invest the support from this loan in restocking her business in order to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and increase her profits. Benita works 12 hours every day at her store, and she is very dedicated to the business. 

The Community Bank Venceremos is grateful to Kiva lenders for their generous support of persons with scarce resources all around the world who want to make an honest living.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her general store, including: rice, sugar, beans, corn, matches, shampoo, detergents, soap, juices, bread, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Shahzia

texts.en:
At the age of 44, Shahzia is a married woman and a mother of three children. She has been running a business making garments for ten years with help of her husband. She is very expert in stitching garments in different designs and sizes. She stitches for the people of her community and also supplies a factory. Her business is good enough to have a decent life. 

For the further improvement of her business she requested a loan of Rs. 50,000 to buy spools of thread and fabric in various colors along with packs of cutters and needles. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread and fabric in various colors along with packs of cutters and needles.

loans.name: Mehbara

texts.en:
Mehbara is 44 years old; she is married and has two sons. In 1990 she started animal husbandry and field crop cultivation. Today Mehbara has managed to grow her business and crop cultivation and has milk cows and one calf as well as land where she plants tomatoes and melon. 

With the purpose of further growing her business, Mehbara has come to VFAC for a loan in the amount of 1200 AZN to buy a calf as well as mineral fertilizer. She plans to invest the income from the loan to increase the headcount of livestock and to remodel her house as well as to help her sons with their plans.

loans.use: To buy a calf and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en:
Shaista is a 32-year-old married woman. She is running a small general store at the corner of her house for the people of her community. She is been involved in this business for a period of about five years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband work as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.   

Shaista is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 50-year-old married woman. Three years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales when her husband got severely ill. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. She buys clothing of different designs from the market in bulk at lower rates and then sells it in her community. She counts a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors. 

Farzana is a mother of four children; two of them are college-going. She wishes to send other children to college but is unable to cover the expenses. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of clothes in a larger quantity to add to her current ones. She desires to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of clothes in a larger quantity.

loans.name: Maqbool

texts.en:
Maqbool is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business selling fruit for many years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They are very enthusiastic about her business of selling fruit and manage to earn a reasonable amount of money to support their family. 

They have five children. She is responsible for their food, health and education and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business.

For the improvement of the business, Maqbool contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas. This will help them to meet market demands consistently. They are very experienced and have good contacts in the market. With this loan, they will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shelving, a refrigerator for chocolate, work tables, publicity and raw materials for the gifts

loans.name: Al Mahaba 1 Group

texts.en:
Al Mahaba is a group composed of three Lebanese ladies. They decided to form the group in order to support each other financially and enhance their respective business.

Nabiha is the leader and featured member of the group. She is a 52-year-old married mother of five children and is standing on the far right of the picture. She plants and harvests all sorts of fruits, which is how she earns her living. Her husband is a chef in a restaurant. She decided to join the group in order to enhance her farming business, which she started two years ago.  She will purchase seeds, chemicals and raw materials that would increase her output. This would be truly beneficial for the socioeconomic status of the family.

As for the other group members, Raghida is the woman standing at the center of the picture, while Nadia is the woman standing on the far left of the picture.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, chemicals and raw materials that would increase her output

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Edoh a 33 ans, marié il a un enfant de 02ans en charge. Il vit dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé où il exerce son activité et compte dans cette dernière près de 04 ans. Il est technicien de profession mais associe à son activité principale la vente des produits d’alimentation générale Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et sollicite un quatrième prêt de WAGES pour augmenter son commerce et avoir un lendemain meilleur avec sa famille.
texts.en: Edoh is 33 years old, married and also responsible for one child of 2 years old. He lives in a district of the city of Lomé where he has his business which he has had for almost four years. He is a technician by profession but at the same time, he also sells groceries. He buys his supplies in the Grand Market in Lomé and is requesting a fourth loan from WAGES to expand his business and have a better tomorrow with his family.

loans.use: To purchase "pure water" (bags of water) and prepaid cell phone credit.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is now a 24-year-old single lady living with her seven siblings. She is now in her fifth year of studying pharmacy. She is seeking another educational loan to continue paying for her educational fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 34 years old and has been doing a business of scrap recycling for the past two years. She buys PET bottles like Pepsi, Coke, Mirinda (500 ml, 1 ltr, 1.5 ltr, and 2.25 ltr) or other similar bottles in scrap. After proper crushing and recycling these bottles, she sells them to the people of her community. Through her business she makes an enough income to contribute to the family's income. 

She has five children, all are school going and she hardly manages to satisfy their needs. She is liable to provide them with good food, health, and education so she requires earning more income to support her family well. 

She is in her second loan cycle with Kashf Foundation, and she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy more bottles in different sizes to inflate her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more bottles in different sizes to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 46 years old and married. She is an enthusiastic lady who has been making wooden baskets at home for many years. She sells them door to door and in fruit markets. She makes a wide range of baskets from different materials. She is very popular in her community. Her husband is employed in a small factory and unable to support his family alone. Nargis's contribution to the family income is enough to support her family well.

She is the mother of four children. She lives in a large conventional family with her husband, children and other relatives. She needs to have an increase in her earnings to carry out the everyday expenditures of her family. To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PKR. She will be using the loan to buy different types of wood in large quantities to offer a variety of baskets to her customers. She wishes to use part of the profits for building a separate room for her children. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy different types of wood in large quantities

loans.name: Afrah

texts.en: Afrah is a 41-year-old married mother of four children. She works as a tailor, and her business is in her home. Her husband is a construction manager, but their combined revenue is very low relative to the fact that they are parents to four children. Two of her children are enrolled in a public school, while the two others are working in order to provide additional support to the family. She decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan which would support her in purchasing furniture for her house in order to have a better environment. As for the future, Afrah wishes to purchase an electric sewing machine which would facilitate her work and increase her output.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her house in order to have a better environment

loans.name: Toulan

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et liqueurs madame Afi femme de 40ans sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour renforcer son commerce et fonder une famille financièrement stable. Notons qu’elle a 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés et a pour conjoint un comptable dans une société.
texts.en: Mrs. Afi, a 40-year old woman, sells basic food items and liquors. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to bolster her business and provide financial stability for her family. It should be noted that she has three children, two of whom are in school; her husband is an accountant for a private firm.   .

loans.use: to buy basic food items.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 33-year-old married woman doing a business of selling milk for the past three years. She has two cows for milk sales. She sells it, along with butter that she makes from the milk, to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

She is a mother of four and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support. 

Now Shahnaz has requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 22-year-old single guy. He lives in a family of six members. 

Abdullah is a fourth-year university student majoring in English language. Besides going to the university, he also works in a clothing shop to make a living for himself. 

Now Abdullah is seeking an educational loan to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора как человек пережила много тягости жизни, не смотря на свою молодость. Она живет вместе со своей семьей на южной части Таджикистана. Она живет с девизом – «хорошее поведение, хорошее обращение и хорошее отношение». С такой логикой она воспитывает своих 4 детей. Нигора всегда нуждалась в деньгах, так как ее муж не имел большого источника дохода. После того как дети выросли, она начала свой бизнес. Более 2 лет она занимается купле продажей канцелярских товаров. Она торгует на местном рынке. Нигора оптом покупает тетрадь, ручки, карандаш, альбом, дневники и т.п. и реализует в розницу. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Она хочет пополнить свой оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Дети выросли и требуют больше благ. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки товара для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: In spite of her youth, Nigora has had to face many hardships in her life. She lives with her family in the south of Tajikistan. Her motto is “good demeanor, good manners and good attitude.” She brings up her children in accordance to these principles. Nigora has always had to struggle financially since her husband’s income has always been low. When her children got older, she launched her own business. For over two years, she has been buying and reselling office supplies. She sells at the local market. Nigora buys notebooks, pens, pencils, drawing pads, agendas etc. wholesale and resells retail. Her husband helps her in her business. She would like to replenish her working capital and thus increase her income. Her children are now big and need more nice things. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 TJS to replenish her working capital and stock up on merchandise. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy stationery goods so as to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Maqsood is a 53-year-old married woman. She is the mother of eight children. She is motivated to provide all facilities of life to her family. 

She has been running a small general store in her community for the last five years with her son, who is also shown in the photo. She offers various goods for daily use and counts on a good client list. 

To cope with the demands of her customers, Maqsood needs to purchase more items, such as packs of biscuits, grains and flour in large quantity. For this, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. With the help of this loan, she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her clients and generate more revenue. 

She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as packs of biscuits, grains and flour in large quantity.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is 32 years old. She lives in the Senaki district with her husband, retired parents-in-law, and three-year-old daughter. Meri requested loans from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land and chickens. On the land, fruit and nut trees are grown. Harvested products are sold together with eggs at the local markets. Meri’s father-in-law is a wood artisan. He is working on private orders to earn an additional income for the family. 

Meri requested a loan from Credo to start up the family business. Meri has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Meri will start trading on clothes and bed clothing. She will purchase the products at the wholesale price from the big market and sell with a price markup among her villagers. 

This will allow her to earn a good profit and increase the family's income. With the increased income, Meri will be able to improve the family's living conditions and ensure a better life for her young daughter.

loans.use: to start trading clothes and bedding

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.es:
Gaudencio tiene 58 años, esta casado con Angelica y tiene 3 hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Vive en una casa hecha de material noble con su esposa. Gaudencio se dedica a la agricultura de productos como el cacao orgánico y árboles frutales. Se inició en esta labor hace 35 años inicialmente como trabajador del lugar pero luego y gracias a las ganancias que percibía compró un terreno agrícola de una hectárea que le sirvió para mantener a su familia. Actualmente cuenta con 3 hectáreas de cultivo donde tiene gran cantidad de plantaciones de cacao, los cuales mantiene en buen estado. Se siente muy feliz con su trabajo porque siempre estuvo al lado de sus hijos y de su esposa quien lo apoya en su trabajo llevándole el almuerzo hasta sus parcelas. Uno de sus principales objetivos es abrir una pequeña tienda de productos comestibles para su esposa y tener ingresos adicionales para su familia. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromere a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En está ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores del lugar y así realizar el retiro de maleza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gaudencio is 58 years old, he is married to Angelica, and he has three children who are all grown and independent.  He lives in a house made of good quality wood along with his wife.  Gaudencio works in agriculture with products like organic cacao and fruit trees. He began this labor 35 years ago, initially as a farm hand but then thanks to his earnings he bought a field the size of an acre and it allowed him to maintain his family.  Currently he has three acres that he plants and he has a large quantity of cacao, which maintains him well.  He feels happy for his work because he was always alongside his children and his wife who supported him in his work, bringing him lunch in the field.  One of his principle objectives is to open a small food store for his wife in order to have additional income for his family.  This is his first loan with Kiva and he feels thankful for the financial support that he receives to move forward. He also promises to comply with his repayments in a punctual manner.

At this time he is asking for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to contract farm hands and thus complete the weeding of his fields.

loans.use: To contract farm hands.

loans.name: Mayra Azucena

texts.es: La sra. Mayra trabaja para una escuela publica desde hace mas de 15 años como profesora de primaria apoyando a niños de 10 - 12 años, es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos, actualmente el credito que se le esta otorgando es para la mejora de un dormitotio, ya que estamos en epoca de invierno y esta teniendo problemas con el techo, donde al acondicionarlo tendran mejores condiciones de vida, agradece a ceprodel por apoyarla en esa inversion necesaria para su vida
texts.en: Mayra has been working for a public school for the past 15 years as an elementary school teacher supporting children ages 10-12. She is a single mother with three children.  Currently she is requesting a loan in order to make improvements on a room, since currently we are in the rainy season and she is having problems with the roof.  Upon improving the roof she will have a better quality of life.  She is thankful to Kiva partner Ceprodel for supporting her in this necessary investment for her life.

loans.use: To improve a room.

loans.name: Khaleda

texts.en:
Khaleda is a 45-year-old married woman. Her husband has recently retired from the military and started helping her with her business, which is curtain tailoring.

She used her previous loan in buying some curtain rings and a few curtains accessories. Now she is applying for another loan to buy some fabric for the business.

loans.use: to buy some fabric for her curtain business.

loans.name: Magi Adilia

texts.es: La Sra. Magi trabaja para una escuela publica desde hace mas de 12 años impartiendo clase a niños de 10 - 12 años, actualmente esta reparando su cocina en el cambio de techo y colocacion de piso cuyo prestamo lo va invertir para mejorar sus condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, actualmente agradece  a ceprodel por apoyar su sueño de mejora de su casa de habitacion
texts.en: Magi has been working for a public school for the past 12 years offering classes to children ages 10-12. Currently she is repairing her kitchen, fixing the roof and the floor.  This loan will help her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  Currently she is thankful to Kiva partner Ceprodel for supporting her dream of improving a room in her home.

loans.use: To repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is 19 years old. He lives in Khoni District with his wife and grandmother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Temur requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig and a milking cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. They milk the cow and produce dairy products for selling, which is the only source of income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Temur requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Temur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Temur will begin trade with fruits and vegetables. He plans to purchase fruits and vegetables from the wholesalers and then resell at a higher price, which enables him to increase the income. 

With increased income, Temur will expand his business in the future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trade with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
47-year-old Besik lives in the Senaki district with his 36-year-old wife and two children (eight and ten years old). Besik requested loans from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is their small monthly salaries. Besik is working as a security guard, and his wife is working as a seller at the local shop. Their additional income is from agriculture. They own a plot of agricultural land where maize is grown. The harvested product is sold at the local market. 

Besik requested a loan from Credo to start up the family business. Besik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Besik will purchase a car. He will start driving the car as a taxi. Besik is a very hard-working man. He wants to improve the family's living conditions and ensure that his children can study in the future, and for this he will work as hard as he can. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car to drive as a taxi

loans.name: Najlaa

texts.en:
Najlaa is 26 years old and is from Gaza. She is married and has three children.

She asked Ryada for this start up loan in order to start up her project of a beauty salon, and to buy some used furniture and some cosmetics.
She hopes that this loan will help her build a career and provide her children with a better life.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the startup enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to start up her project of a beauty salon and to buy some used furniture and some cosmetics.

loans.name: Rayil

texts.en:
Rayil is a youth client who is 24 years old, married, and a father of a girl. Rayil is the only provider for his family. 

He owns a garage, where he specializes in fixing damaged car parts. He buys old Soviet cars' spare parts. He has been in this field since 2007, and his reputation and experience have grown rapidly. 

Rayil's house is not in good condition. Among other things, it needs windows, a hallway, laundry room, floors, and part of the roof needs replacement. 
He needs to repair it before the rains come, as the water comes into the interior of his home every time it rains. He has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN so that he can buy all needed construction materials. Obtaining this loan makes him feel very happy.

loans.use: to buy all necessary construction materials to start the repair works on his house.

loans.name: Gurbat

texts.en:
Gurbat is a 34-year-old married man and father of three children. He has owned a barbershop for the past 10 years. He started this occupation in order to help his father financially and decided to stick with this profession as he believed that it’s his hobby and that he will succeed working it. He has a very successful barber shop.

Today, Gurbat wants to renovate his salon and to buy an air conditioner; he reports that the renovation will help him attract more customers and therefore he will earn a higher income. He is very positive, and he only aims to improve his business and enhance his way of living.

loans.use: to renovate his salon and to buy an air conditioner.

loans.name: Shofaa

texts.en:
Shofaa is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be perseverant. She operates a retail store where she sells flour, sugar, tea leaves, etc. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are local traders. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient water for consumption. 

She will use the KES 15,600 loan to purchase a water tank. This is her fourth application for a loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was for KES 30,000, which she paid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 31-year-old single woman. She has two children with ages ranging from eight years to 13 years. She describes herself to be hard-working. She operates a farming business where she sells vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, and peas. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate water supply for farming. She will use the Kes 15,600 loan to purchase a water tank. This is her first application of loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is 50 years old. She lives in a small village in the Senaki district in Nosiri with her husband and retired mother in-law. Tsitsino requested loans from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from agriculture. They have two milk cows, two calves, a pig, and a plot of land where vegetables are grown. The cows are milked every day to produce cheese. From the pig they sell piglets. The family members are very hard-working people, and they all are involved in their agriculture. The harvested products and cheese are sold at the local Senaki market. As the family has a refugee status, they get an additional income from local government institutions. 

Tsitsino requested a loan from Credo to start-up the family business. Tsitsino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Tsitsino will start trading clothes. She will purchase at the wholesale price to resell with the price markup among her villagers. Tsitsino wants to increase the family income to renovate their house. After the renovation is done, all the family members will be able to enjoy their life better. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start trading clothes

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is 26 years old and single. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli City. Rovshan lives in the Baku region with his mother. She stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. 

Rovshan started his business four years ago to transport freight, primarily furniture. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to repair his vehicle inside. 

He wants to use the profit to get married and have a big family. In the future, Rovshan wants to have three children. Rovshan is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle inside.

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
La señora Dora Liseth es madre soltera, tiene 22 años de edad, curso 3 años de educacion secundaria, tiene 1 hijo que aun no estudia, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, inició este negocio ayudando a una amiga a vender productos y a la fecha lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo comprando mercadería variada para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientas, desea en el futuro contar con capital propio y tener una tienda de productos de belleza. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa, tienda de artículos de consumo diario y venta de tortillas
texts.en:
Dora Liseth is 22 years old and is a single mother to her young son. She was only able to complete three years of high school, but she works very hard to support her son by operating a cosmetics sales business. She sells her products through catalogs, and started her business three years ago while helping a friend in a similar endeavor.

The "Damas Unidas" (United Women) group pictured above came together with the common goal of supporting each other's business endeavors and leveraging the opportunities of a loan to grow and strengthen their respective businesses. In Dora Liseth's case, she plans to use the support from this loan to purchase health and beauty merchandise to stock her business and fill client orders. The other group members make a living selling cosmetics, selling clothing, operating a convenience store and making and selling tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale at her business.

loans.name: Yenit Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Yenit trabaja para una escuela publica desde hace mas de 10 años en los grados de 3ro y 4to con niños de 8 - 10 años, ella aduce sentirse bien impartiewndo clase apoyando a los niños, actualmente se le otorgo un credito para realizar una pared limitrofe de su casa de habitacion, se siente muy agradecida por ser benificiada con este credito ya que le va brintar mayor seguridad en su casa de habitacion a ella y su familia
texts.en: Yenit has been working for a public school for more than ten years, teaching 3rd and 4th grade to children ages 8-10. She feels good teaching classes and helping children.  Currently she is asking for a loan in order to build an outer wall around her home. She feels very thankful for the loan opportunity since it will bring greater security to her home for herself and for her family.

loans.use: To build an outer wall.

loans.name: Edita Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Edita trabaja para una escuela publica de primaria desde hace mas de 15 años, actualmente esta realizando un diplomado donde se capacita para tener y brinda una mejor educacion obteniendo una mejor capacidad de mejorar su nivel academico, agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo brindado para realizar esa inversion lo que le ayudara a darle una mejor condicion de vida a ella y su familia
texts.en:
Edita has worked for a public elementary school for over 15 years.  She is now getting a certification where she is trained to have and to give a better education.  She is getting a greater capacity to improve her academic level.

She is grateful to CEPRODEL for the support given in order to make this investment.  It will help her to give herself and her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for application and educational expenses.

loans.name: Marta Gioconda

texts.es: La Sra. Marta trabaja para una escuela publica desde hace mas de 15 años como maestra de primaria donde enseña a niños de 10- 12 años, actualmente esta pasando por un problema de salud donde necesita realizarse una serie de examanes como ultrasonido y compra de medicamentos, actualmente agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo por medio del credito otorgado para su recuperacion
texts.en: Marta has been working for a public school for more than 15 years as an elementary school teacher, teaching children ages 10-12. Currently she is having a health problem and needs to complete a series of ultrasound exams and purchase medicines. She is thankful to Kiva partner Ceprodel for helping with a loan during her recovery.

loans.use: To complete medical exams and an ultrasound.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es: Delicia tiene 39 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y su hija. Delicia se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como leches, arroz, azúcar, entre otros. Su tienda está instalada en su casa ubicada en una esquina con mucho tráfico, ahí atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. Tiene 5 años dedicándose a este negocio, que inició con un capital propio y viendo los buenos resultados que le generaba sus ventas decidió continuar, ahora ocasionalmente necesita el apoyo de un ayudante a quien paga diariamente. Se inició en este rubro debido a la necesidad de contar con una ocupación y apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar, además se siente una persona productiva e independiente. Desea ver crecer su negocio y que se refleje en el bienestar de su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas. Se compromete a ser un cliente puntual y muy responsable. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos comestibles como leches, arroz, azúcar y verduras para su tienda.
texts.en:
Delicia, age 39, is married and lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter.  Delicia sells food products like milk, rice, and sugar, among others.  Her store is set up in her house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic.  That is where she very kindly tends to her customers.  She has had this business for five years.  She started with her own capital.  Upon seeing the good results that her sales generated for her, she decided to continue.  She now occasionally needs the support of a helper, whom she pays daily.

She started in this field due to the need to have an occupation and to support her life partner with the household expenses.  Also, she feels like a productive and independent person.  She wishes to see her business grow, and she wishes to see that reflected in her family’s well-being.

She will now request 1,000 soles.  She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her in order to access the loan, which she needs in order to continue meeting her goals.  She pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client.  She will use the requested loan to buy food products like milk, rice, sugar, and vegetables for her store.

loans.use: to buy food products like milk, rice, sugar, and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny es una mujer de 36 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos. Varios años atrás, ella y su familia fueron desplazados por la violencia que se presentaba en el campo. Actualmente se dedica a atender un restaurante que tomó en arriendo, luego de haber obtenido experiencia en el sector cuando trabajaba como empleada del servicio en varios restaurantes. Es una persona luchadora y trabajadora, se esmera por obtener ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, laborando arduas jornadas, todos los días de la semana. Con el crédito que solicita desea hacer mejoras locativas y comprar surtido (arroz, verduras, carne, gaseosas, frutas, mecato) para generar una percepción más agradable a los clientes y así poder aumentar sus ventas. Su principal sueño es poder generar más oportunidades de empleo en su restaurante.
texts.en: Marleny is a 36 year old woman and single mother with three children.  Several years back, she and her family were displaced by the violence that occurred in the rural areas in Colombia. Currently she works at a restaurant that she started after gaining experience in that field while working as a service employee in various restaurants.  She is a hard-working and tenacious person. She takes great pains in order to obtain an income to support her household, working arduous hours every day of the week. With the loan that she is requesting she will make improvements to her restaurant and purchase stock (rice, vegetables, meat, soft drinks, fruit, pastries) in order to offer her clients a more pleasing experience and thus increase her sales. Her main dream is to be able to generate more opportunities for employment in her restaurant.

loans.use: To make improvements to her restaurant and to purchase rice, vegetables, meat, soft drinks, fruit, and pastries.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 43 years old. She lives in Tbilisi with her husband Akaki and her 20 years-old student son. Marina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were  denied because of low family income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Akaki works as an artisan for a private building company and gets small monthly income, which is the only source of income for the family. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Marina requested loan a from Credo for a start-up family business. Marina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides fund for business start-ups and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Marina will open a bakery. She needs to buy the raw materials for baking Georgian bread. She has no experience in this field yet, but she will do her best to make her business profitable. Part of the income will be reinvested in the business. With another part she will pay her son’s educational expenses. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a bakery.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living condition there are bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions,  and over population. Most interesting is that rooms are a bit cheaper for travelers and it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia. Food is also less expensive.  

Tina is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have five children with ages between 25 and 10; only three of their children are currently attending school and living at home. Tina was unable to attend school but she started a table market business that she has been involved with selling charcoal, pepper, and red oil. With the loan she will buy additional inventory to have enough goods on her table in the market. She said that besides having fewer goods on her table, she has no other problems for now. 

Her cousin loaned her money to establish this business. She learned by seeing other businesswomen fifteen years ago. She said that she enjoys the fast buying from costumers. Her dreams are to move from a table business to a shop business and to educate all her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to have enough goods at her table in the market.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de flores,la socia cultiva flores y lo vende en las diferenestes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de flores.la socia solicita para comprar flores como rosas y claveles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member buys and sells flowers for a living. She grows the flowers and sells them in different markets. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She has been doing this work for the past six years and it has been going well. Her dream is to expand her flower business. She is asking for this loan in order to buy flowers such as roses and carnations.
This member is happy to have this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy flowers such as roses and carnations.

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ligia habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijos sus planes a futuro son mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada y con eso ha hido construyendo su casa, con este nuevo credito Ligia comprara: Piedra cantera, Cemento, un Viaje de Piedrin, un viaje de Arena, Hierro. con esto podra construir gran parte de su vivienda.Agradece el apoyo de Afodenic quien a travez de Fondo Kiva ayuda a personas que necesitan mejorar de vida.
texts.en:
Ligia lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and children. Her plan for the future is to improve her living conditions. 

Ligia sells new and used clothing and with these earnings she has begun building a house. With this loan, Ligia would buy paving stones, cement, a truckload of gravel, a truckload of sand, and metal, which will allow her to build most of her house. 

She is grateful for the support given to her by Afodenic, which, through Kiva, helps people who need to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase materials for construction

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Faustina;la socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de verduras como zanahorias, cebollas, apio entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, a la vez la socia continua dedicandose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas , siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de gallinas para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO” Community Bank. This bank is located in the province and municipality of Cusco. 
This borrower is named Mrs. Faustina. She continues with her business selling and buying vegetables such as carrots, onions and garlic among others. She has been in this business for a while, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business each day. She continues to sell in the markets in Cusco. She also continues to raise young animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. This is the means that she has to help her family to progress.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy chickens for her business.
She is thankful for this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata; la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de verduras, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, a la vez la socia también continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes y alimentos para sus animalitos como alfalfa.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO” Community Bank. This bank is located in the province and municipality of Cusco. This borrower’s name is Mrs. Fortunata. She continues with her business buying and selling vegetables. She is a responsible and hardworking woman, which is how she helps her family to progress. She continues selling her products in Cusco. She also raises young animals such as guinea pigs. She would like to continue working, as this is how she supports her family.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy guinea pigs and food for the animals such as alfalfa.
She is thankful for this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and food for the animals such as alfalfa.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur, 30, is a married man. He lives in a small village named Akhuti in Chkhorotsku District. He lives with his wife, retired mother, and two school-going children. 

Temur has been unsuccessful in acquiring a loan from local financial institutions to start a family business. His loan requests were rejected because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. In addition to farming income, Temur's mother has a monthly pension and a salary of 180 Lari from working at the local kindergarten.
 
The family has two milk cows and a plot of arable land. The cows are milked daily and the milk is made into dairy products. Nut and bay trees are grown on the land. Both the harvested and dairy products are sold at the local markets. 

Temur requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credits with flexible conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products. The rural poor are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Temur will renovate a commercial space and purchase groceries to open a grocery shop. Temur and his family members will work in the shop to decrease expenses and increase profit. Part of the profit will be used to expand the business and purchase a greater variety products to better satisfy the clients' needs. The new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate a commercial space and purchase groceries to open a grocery shop

loans.name: Dafrosa

texts.en:
Dafrosa is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children who are four and eight years old. She describes herself as faithful. 

Dafrosa operates a farming business where she sells cabbage, kale, and tomatoes. Her business is located in a rural area. Her biggest business challenge is inadequate water for farming. She will use the KES 15,600 loan to purchase a water tank. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Carina

texts.es: Carina tiene 38 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Carina se dedica a la venta de comida como desayunos y almuerzos regionales. Todos estos alimentos los prepara en su propia casa y los vende a su distinguida clientela. También ese local lo alquila para recepciones y diversos eventos sociales como quinceañeras, matrimonios, fiesta de promoción, bautizos y otros. Se inició hace 3 años con un capital pequeño, pero viendo la buena acogida fue aumentando la extensión de su local. Inicio trabajar para tener una ocupación, sentirse una persona productiva y una próspera empresaria e independiente. Ahora  viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de ampliar su local para aumentar la capacidad de personas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará más sillas y mesas para atender cómodamente a sus clientes.
texts.en: Carina is 38 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. Carina sells prepared food from the region, particularly breakfasts and lunches. She prepares this food at home and sells it to her customers. She also rents her location for receptions and other events such as fifteenth birthday celebrations, weddings, graduations, baptisms and other events. She began her business three years ago with a little bit of working capital. Experiencing the warm welcome her business received, she increased the size of her location. She started to work in order to have an occupation. She felt that she was a productive person and an independent and successful entrepreneur. Now she is seeing the good results of her work. She would like to expand her location in order to accommodate more people. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles. She is thankful and content to know that she can continue to count on the financial assistance she needs in order to grow her business. With the money from this loan, she will buy the tables and chairs that she needs for the comfort of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and tables so that she can have more customers in her business.

loans.name: Emiterio

texts.es:
Emiterio nació en la ciudad de Ocongate pero vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo junto con su familia, él tiene 57 años edad y es casado fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos.  

Emiterio es carpintero de profesión y tiene un taller de carpintería en su domicilio donde elabora diferentes muebles de madera como por ejemplo carpetas, sillas, roperos, etc. Ya son 30 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor De Torrechayoc” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera.

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. 

(La ciudad Paucartambo está ubicada en el distrito del Paucartambo en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Emiterio was born in the city of Ocongate but lives in the city of Paucartambo with his family. He is 57 years old, married, and has five children from this marriage. 

Emiterio is a carpenter by profession and has a workshop in his home where he creates a variety of wooden furniture, such as desks, chairs, closets, etc. He has been in this business for 30 years now, and is doing well thanks to his dedication to his work. He is a hard working and enterprising person who supports his family. 

He belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Torrechayoc" and at this time requires the loan to purchase working materials such as wood. Emiterio is grateful for and appreciates the loan, and is committed to making his monthly payments. 

(The city of Paucartambo is located in the district of Paucartambo in the province of Paucartambo which is part of the region of Cuzco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy working materials such as wood.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia Eulogia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia, la socia vende las vacas los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia también se dedica al negocio de ventas de verduras como zanahorias, tomates y cebollas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ganados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Eulogia continues her work raising cattle.  She sells cows, letting them grow and fatten.  She then sells them at different markets.  She also works selling vegetables such as carrots, tomatoes, and onions.  She works from 8:00 a.m to 6:00 p.m.  She has had this business for 5 years and it is going well for her.  She is asking for this loan to buy cattle.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: buy cattle.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children whose ages range between 8 and 12 years old. She describes herself as faithful. 

Serah operates a farm where she sells cabbage, kale, and tomatoes. Her business is located in a rural area. Her biggest business challenge is inadequate water for farming. She will use the KES 15,600 loan to purchase a water tank. This is her first loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Saa

texts.en: Saa is a hardworking woman who does her best to meet the needs of her family and the community at large. She has a business of selling fish at the market. The previous loan that she received helped her to boost her business. She is now requesting for a loan of Kshs 50,000 to buy more stock of fish and cooking oil for the preparation of dried fish for sale to her clients. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and cooking oil for the preparation of dried fish

loans.name: Agrey

texts.en:
Agrey lives and works outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia, one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, the oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano in East Africa. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Agrey is married and has six children, the youngest of whom accompanied him to the Kiva loan meeting and is pictured above. Both him and his wife have been farming for fifteen years, and they are currently growing maize, sugar cane and bananas on their land. Agrey likes beekeeping because he believes "it is a project that will succced since it is done by professionals." He is also interested in having another revenue stream coming from his farm. 

This is Agrey's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children. In the future, Agrey hopes to ensure that his children can continue through school and get a good education.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex lives in a small town outside of Kamukuywa, close to Kitale in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. At over 6,300 feet above sea level, Kamukuywa is one of Africa’s highest elevation towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of  “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested, many farmers grow sunflower on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees.
