Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting bluegum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Alex is married, and has four children. His wife works as a business lady while he farms their land. He has been farming for over 30 years and is currently growing maize, bananas and coffee. He is also running a dairy farm. He likes working with Honey Care because "they have a ready market for my honey" and he likes the Kiva partnership because it has enabled him to get beehives on loan. Alex also likes beekeeping because "it is a low labor business and the returns are good. The apiary also takes a small section of my farm. It has also encouraged me to plan trees for conservation."

This is Alex's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to expand his beekeeping "to produce maximum kilos of honey." In the future, Alex's dream is to educate his children "to a higher level."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is single and lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She operates a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food kiosk operators in her area. 

With a loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Cirila se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja en este negocio 8 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Cirila continues to work raising animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She lets with fatten and grow and then sells them in various markets.  She has had this business for 8 years and it is going well for her.  Her dream is to have her own shop where she can sell her animals.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Cirila is happy to get this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for basic goods, a sewing machine and to add air-conditoning to her workshop.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is 58 years old. He lives in Tsageri district with his wife and retired mother. Vakhtang requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Vakhtang is working as a welder on private orders and earns 350 Lari per month. They also rent a room in their house. Additional income for the family comes from Vakhtang’s mother’s monthly pension.

Vakhtang requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Vakhtang has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Vakhtang will renovate more rooms in their house to rent them out. He will purchase all the needed materials and hire the builders. After the renovation is done the room prices will be higher, and Vakhtang will earn a good income for the family. He wants to improve the family's living conditions. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will help the family to have a better life.

loans.use: To renovate more rooms in their house to rent them out

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a divorced mother with three children who go to school. They live at their own house that has no electricity or piped water. 

She operates a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food kiosk operators and limited finances to boost her business. 

With a loan of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale.

loans.name: Amana

texts.en:
Amana is single and has been blessed with two children who go to school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. It is a challenge to provide food for the family and fees for the children. 

For some years she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables and also buy threads for sewing sweaters.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives and works outside of Kamukuywa, near Kitale town in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. His home is located close to the Ugandan border and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover on behalf of the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Henry is married and has nine children. Both he and his wife have been farming for 35 years and are currently growing maize, vegetables and ground nuts on their land. Henry is excited to start beekeeping because "bees have no cost to keep and they are important to the ecosystem."
 
This is Henry's first loan, and he plans to use the proceeds to educate his children, and the children of his brother, who are now orphans. When asked about his hope for the future, Henry said he wants "to live a more gratifying life together with my children and those of my late brother."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carlota; la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de verduras en uno de los mercados del Cusco, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes y alimentos para sus animalitos.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Ima Sumac Suncco” communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Carlota. She continues with her business of raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has had her business for a long time, and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. At the same time she continues selling vegetables in one of the markets in Cusco. She wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and feed for her animals.

She is happy because of the loan and pledges to complete her repayments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in New Kru Town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. The living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, few bathrooms, filthy conditions, over population, but the most interesting part is that rooms and food are a bit cheaper, there is the option of traveling, and the town contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia.  
  
Rebecca is married, and her husband works in the beer factory in Monrovia. They both have four children, whose ages are between 28 and 12. Only two of their children are currently attending school and live at home. Rebecca was unable to attend school, but she started a table market business, which sells rice by the cup in the market of New Kru Town.  With the loan proceeds, she will buy enough rice by the bag to increase her sales. Her problem is few goods on her table; she has no additional problems for now. With a little money from her husband, she managed to establish this business, and she learned by observing other businesswomen ten years ago. She stated, "I enjoy the fast buying from costumers". Her dreams are to move from a table business to a shop business and to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to buy enough bags of rice to increase her sales.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Trinidad; la socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de leña, la socia vende a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de leña para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Ima Sumac Suncco” communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Trinidad. She continues with her business of buying and selling firewood. She sells to her customers when they request it from her. She is a responsible person. She wants to keep working so that she can continue helping her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy firewood for her business.

She is happy because of the loan and pledges to complete her repayments.

loans.use: to buy firewood for her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia se dedica  el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, gaseosas, aceite entre otros, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene buen tiempo en ese negocio, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y gaseosas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member, Julia, has a small grocery store. She sells different kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, and cooking oil, among other things. She works from 8:00am until 10:00pm. She has been in this business for a long time. Her dream is to grow her grocery store business. 

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and soft drinks.

She is happy because of the loan and pledges to complete her repayments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Muhina

texts.en:
Muhina, 33, is a divorced woman with two children who all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

She operates a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a café in the near future. 

With the 15,000 KES, she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard lives outside of Kamukuywa, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s highest towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested, many farmers grow sunflower on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting bluegum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Bernard is married and has seven children. He works as a teacher, while his wife farms their land. She is currently growing sugarcane and tissue culture bananas, a new method of growing the fruit that is providing extremely high-quality and high-yield plants. He likes beekeeping because it is an inexpensive project with good returns. 

This is Bernard's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children as well as furthering his own education. In the future, Bernard's hope is to improve his living standards, and advance his career in teaching.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kamukuywa, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to the Ugandan border, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano, which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Betty is married and has four children. Her husband works as a teacher, while she farms their land. She is currently nurturing a tree plantation, and growing maize, vegetables and sugarcane. She is excited to start beekeeping because she believes that "bees are excellent insects to work with and learn from. Their honey is good food and the income is good too."

This is Betty's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to help educate her children. Betty's dream for the future is to see her children educated "to a high level."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Limic

texts.en:
Limic lives in New Kru Town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. The living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, few bathrooms, filthy conditions, over population, but the most interesting part is that the rooms and food are a bit cheaper, there is the option of traveling, and contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia. 
   
Limic is married, and her husband works as a secretary at his office. They have five children, whose ages are between 32 and 18; only two of their children are currently attending school and live at home. Limic completed grade 11 before starting a cook shop business that sells rice and soup in the market of New Kru Town. With the loan proceeds, she will buy more stock (rice, pepper, oil, dry fish, dry meat, onion, vita, etc.) to have enough food ingredients in stock. She said, "Besides fewer goods on my table market, I have no other problems for now". With a little money from her mother she managed to establish this business, and she learned by observing other cook shop businesswomen twenty-five years ago. She stated, "I enjoy the flow of costumers, and they boast of the food I prepare saying it’s delicious!"  Her dreams are to move from a cook shop business to a Restaurant business, build a house, and live a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock (rice, pepper, oil, dry fish, dry meat, onion, vita, etc.) to have enough food ingredients in stock.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juana, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijos quienes le apoya en todo, continua con sus planes hacia un futuro, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda y darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, doña juana trabaja duro para poder ayudar en gastos del hogar, al igual su esposo trabaja por maestro de obra para un residencial, con este nuevo credito construira parate de su casa y comprara los siguientes materiales: Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, Hierro, Estrivos, Tablas. para y su esposo se les ha hecho dificil recoger de una sola vez el dinero para comprar estos materiales, pero gracias a Afodenic y a Fondos Kiva.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the city of Ticuantepe with her husband and children, who support her in all she does.  She is continuing with her plans towards the future.  She wants to improve her home and give her children better living conditions.  Juana works ward to be able to help with the household expenses.  Similarly, her husband works as a foreman for a residential complex.

With this new loan, she will build part of her house and buy the following supplies: concrete blocks, cement, sand, piedrin (building stones), iron, brackets, and boards.

For Juana and her husband it has been difficult to gather all of the money needed to buy these materials at once, but thanks to Afodenic and Kiva funds it is possible.

loans.use: buy construction materials.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga; la socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia cría a sus vacas para luego venderlos a sus clientes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir  apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimentos para sus vacas como forraje entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Ima Sumac Suncco” communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Carlota. She continues with her cattle business. She is a responsible and hardworking person. She raises her cows and then sells them to her customers. She wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family. 

She is requesting the loan to buy feed for her cows, such as fodder, among other things.

She is happy because of the loan and pledges to complete her repayments.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cows, such as fodder, among other things.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in a small town outside of Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, the oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano in East Africa. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Beatrice is married, and has five children. Her husband works as a technician for the Nzoia Water Company, while she farms their land; she is currently growing maize, bananas and beans. She is excited to work with Honey Care because "they are professionals in the industry and I have no doubt in my mind that this project they have initiated will be successful." She is also interested in starting beekeeping because "I love honey and the money from honey will push me a long way."

This is Beatrice's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to pay school fees for her five children. When asked about her hopes and dreams for the future, Beatrice said that she wishes "to have a stable income throughout life. I am looking at this business as my retirement benefit."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel, 30 years old, is a married man; he has two children who attend school. Samwel owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Samwel has operated a door-to-door motorcycle transport business where passersby and town dwellers are his potential clients. He faces the challenge of seasonality especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate his business. 

With the Kshs 25,000 he wants to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle and purchase seedlings for farming. Samwel joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle and purchase

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu, aged 29 years, is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a farming business, selling farming produce from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanamkuu dreams of establishing more business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KSh 50,000, she wants to purchase cereals and fertilizers for her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMA SUMAC SUNCCO”; El banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas y también continua dedicándose a la ganadería y  venta de verduras como zanahorias entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the communal bank "Ima Sumac Suncco."  The bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Alejandrina continues to raise small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens for her business.  In addition, she continues to work raising cattle and selling vegetables such as carrots and others.  She desires to be able to keep working and thereby continue to support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.  She is happy to have this loan and promises to make all her payments on time.

loans.use: by guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia Alejandra se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja en este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Alejandra continues to work raising animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She lets them fatten and grow and then sells them at different markets.  She has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to have her own shop where she can sell her animals.  She is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Alejandra is happy to have this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia Ana se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja en este negocio 9 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Ana continues to make a living raising animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She fattens them up, and once they're grown she sells them in a number of different markets. She has been in this business for nine years and is quite successful. Her dream is to have a stall where she can sell her animals. She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Ana is very happy about this loan and is committed to paying it off on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en: Amalyn is 34 years old, married and has three children living in Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. They work rice fields for a living. Aside from farming, she also sells food in the school canteen to generate more income for the family. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more stock, such as biscuits, soft drinks, bread and pastries for sale. She hopes to improve her farm and her business as well.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as biscuits, soft drinks, bread and pastries for sale

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en:
Lorpu lives in New Kru Town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. The living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, few bathrooms, filthy conditions, over population, but the most interesting part is that the rooms and food are a bit cheaper, there is the option of traveling, and it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia.
    
Lorpu is single and has five children whose ages are between 18 and 5; only three of her children are currently attending school and live at home.

Lorpu was unable to attend school, but she is busy running her shop, which sells charcoal in the market of New Kru Town. With the loan proceeds, she will buy more charcoal for her business. She said, "Beside fewer goods on my table market, I have no other problem for now". With a  little money from her mother she managed to establish this business fifteen years ago, and she learned by observing other businesswomen. She stated that she enjoys the flow of costumers and the fast buying.  Her dreams are to move from the charcoal business to a store business, and to live a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita, humilde, trabajadora, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su familia, su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, su esposo la apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que trabaja para una empresa privada, ella por su parte es comerciante vende fritangas los fines de semana, con este credito comprar materiales para seguir construyendo su vivienda, esta vez comprara. Cemento, Hierro, Bloques , etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Margarita is a humble, hardworking woman who lives in Ticuantepe with her family. Her biggest dream is to be able to improve her living conditions. Her husband works for a private company and helps her with the household expenses. Margarita sells fried treats on the weekends. She will use this loan to buy materials to keep building her house. This time she will buy cement, rebar, cinder blocks, and other supplies. She is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have provided her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La socia Dorotea se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras  y ganaderia, la socia trabaja en este negocio 7 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Dorotea continues working in the business of raising animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She makes them fatten up and grow and then she sells them in different markets.  She also makes a living selling vegetables and livestock.  She has worked in this business for 7 years and it is going very well for her.  Dorotea’s dream is to have a place where she can sell animals.  She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Dorotea is happy about the loan and she is committed to complying with the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Nerme

texts.en: Nerme is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She lives in Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she owns and manages a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale (and a portion of the product will be used for family consumption). In order to buy fertilizer, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit in the amount of 4,500 PHP. She hopes to gain an abundant harvest to have more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Isaac Nazario

texts.es:
Isaac nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su familia, él tiene 60 años edad y es casado fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.  

Isaac es carpintero, es artesano y también es empleado público, él tiene un pequeño taller de artesanía y carpintería en su domicilio donde elabora diferentes muebles de madera y elabora mascaras de danzas para la fiesta patronal de la ciudad de Paucartambo.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor De Torrechayoc” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo yeso, alambre, pinturas y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. 

(La ciudad Paucartambo está ubicada en el distrito del Paucartambo en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Isaac was born in the city of Paucartambo and now lives in there together with his family. He is 60 years old and is married with three children.

Isaac is a carpenter, an artisan, as well as a public employee. He has a small artisanal and carpentry workshop in his home where he makes assorted wood furniture and ceremonial masks for the festival of the patron saint of the city of Paucartambo. He has been managing this business for many years and it is going very well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person who works to keep his family ahead. He is a member of the "Señor De Torrechayoc" community bank, and with this loan cycle he will purchase working materials such as plaster, wire, paint, and other products. He is grateful for and values the funding and promises to comply with his monthly payments. 

(The city of Paucartambo is located in the district of Paucartambo in the province of Paucartambo, within the region of Cusco, Perú.)

loans.use: purchase work materials such as plaster, wire, paint, and other products.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is now a widower who lives with her 2 dependents. Lilia is 46 years old, and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Lilia has owned and operated a gardening business to earn a living for two years. Aside from gardening, she also manages her store selling goods in the community. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to buy rice and corn grits for resale. In the future, Lilia wants to build a house and to help her grandchildren finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn grits for resale

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 44-years-old, married, and has four siblings. 

To make a living, Ellen buys and sells banana products. Ellen has been in her business for two years and she earns 20,000 PHP per month from this work.

Aside from vending, she also gains income from her service based business providing transportation and motor rental in their community.

Recently, she is requesting a loan of 13,500.00 PHP, which will be used to buy accessories and a new set of tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and expand her buy and sell business.

loans.use: to buy accessories and a new set of tires.

loans.name: Verhinda

texts.en:
Verhinda is a 42-year-old married woman and has an only child living with her family in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she helps her husband to manage their own rice farm. They plant and harvest rice mainly for family consumption and a portion of it is sold in the market for their daily expenses. 

She has borrowed a loan from Kiva partner GDMPC micro credit in the amount of 8,000.00 PHP in order to finance the cost of farmland  preparation and buy fertilizer. She hopes to renovate their house in order to live comfortably.

loans.use: to finance the cost of farmland preparation and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Dioan

texts.en:
Dioan is a widow who is 48-years-old and resides at Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Dioan owns and operates a coconut production to earn a living, and she earns 4,000 PHP doing this business. Aside from  doing this, she also manages a store selling goods in their community. Recently, she requests a loan of 4,500.00 PHP from Kiva partner GDMPC micro credit in order to buy additional canned goods and dairy products to sell.

In the future, Dioan wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods and dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 33-years-old, married and lives in Canibungan Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Norma plants bananas on her own plot of land to earn a living. She also cultivates a farm planting and harvesting corn to sell.  Recently, she requested a loan of 12,500 PHP in order to buy fertilizer such as manure. In the future, Norma's plan is to save her profits in order to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Javhlan

texts.en:
Mr. Javhlan is 33-years-old and lives with his wife and daughter in a small house in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife Odontungalag is 31-years-old and she helps her husband to run their family business of crafting traditional shoes and slippers. His daughter Amirlan is three years old and has started going to the local kindergarten. 

Javhlan and his wife started their business of making traditional boots, summer shoes, slippers in the Ger on their plot of land. They sell their products in some big souvenir shops and bigger markets. He is now borrowing 1,600,000MNT in order to purchase large amounts of inventory for the high season of tourists.  The Javhlan's are happy, hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of inventory for the high season of tourists.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enhtuya is 55-years-old and lives with her son and daughter in a small house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her son, Dorjbalbar, is 24-years-old and a university student. Her daughter, Dolgorjav, helps her mother to produce organic dairy products at home. Enhtuya started her business in 2005. She had lost her ability to work and gets a small amount of pension. She sells her products in Ulaanbaatar city. She is well-experienced since she lived with her parents in the countryside herding livestock and producing a variety of dairy products. 

She is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000MNT in order to purchase construction material to build a workplace on her plot of land and to purchase different shapes and produce a different variety of dairy products. She is a hardworking, positive and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase construction material to build a workplace on her plot of land and to purchase different shapes and produce a different variety of dairy products.

loans.name: Hurmanhan

texts.en:
Mr. Hurmanhan is 52-years-old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife is named Altagul and his son serves in the local military service. His daughter studies at university and his youngest son studies at the local secondary school. 

Mr. Hurmanhan retired from military service and started his organic vegetable growing and sales business. He has years of experience and lots of help from his family. He grows organic vegetables on his and his brother's plot of land. He sells to retailers at the local market. He is a hardworking and diligent man who is requesting a loan of 6,000,000MNT in order to prepare for this year's plantation season and renovate his house before the weather gets cold.

loans.use: to prepare for this year's plantation season and renovate his house before the weather gets cold.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married and lives in Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. For a living, she helps her husband to manage their own farm of coconut, banana and corn. She has been doing this for many years.

She became a member of Kiva partner GDMPC in 2008 and it helps her a lot to improve her being an entrepreneur. Recently, she borrowed the amount of 19,000.00 PHP in order to buy fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to generate an increased harvest in order to increase the family income.

loans.use: to  buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en:
Lorpu lives in New Kru Town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions, and overpopulation, but the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there is the option of traveling, it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and has lower prices on food.

34-year-old Lorpu is married. Her husband works as driver at his office, and they both have five children between 10 and 2. Only three of her children are currently attending school and live at home. Lorpu was unfortunately unable to attend school, but she is busy running her shop which sells charcoal in the market of New Kru Town. With the loan proceeds she will buy more pepper, oil, beans, peanut, etc. for her business. She said; beside fewer goods on my table at the market, I have no other problem for now. With a little money from her mother she managed to established this business fifteen years ago, and learned by seeing other businesswomen. She stated; I enjoy the flows of customers and the fast buying. Her dreams are to move from the charcoal business to a store business, and live a better life in future.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, beans, peanuts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia, 44 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with one child. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 1 year, in this business she earns a net income of 300 PHP daily. Lydia would like a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to purchase coffee, sugar, canned goods, biscuits, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can use it to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, canned goods, biscuits, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Andresita

texts.en: Andresita of Bañadero, Ozamiz City is a married woman and a mother of five children. For a living, she helps her husband by operating a store selling goods in their community. She has been doing this for many years. Recently, she borrwed a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which she joined recently in order to purchase goods like noodles, biscuits and candies to sell. She hopes to expand her business so their family can have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goods like noodles, biscuits and candies to sell.

loans.name: Delgerbayar

texts.en: Delgerbayar is 32 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a small house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband Lhagvasuren has been running a taxi service business in town since 2008. Her 3-year-old daughter Enerjin goes to the local kindergarten. Delgerbayar works as a saleswoman in the local market and she is now starting to grow organic vegetables on their plot of land. She and her husband used to help their parents to grow and sell organic vegetables for years. She is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase seedlings, seeds and soils for the plantation of her organic vegetable-growing business. She is a hardworking, optimistic and open-minded woman.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, seeds and soils for the plantation of her organic vegetable-growing business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is married, 58 years old and a mother of four. To make a living, she sells food and manages a sari-sari store selling goods in the community of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has been doing this for many years. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles and bottled products to sell. In the near future, she plans to renovate the shelter to have a convenience store and gain more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, noodles and bottled products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spices, soy sauce, vinegar, hot dog sticks, and cooking oil to use in her food-vending business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is from Labo, Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old. Evangeline is married and has two children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. She has been in her business for years.

To gain more income, she also raises pigs to sell in their community.

In 2006, Evangeline joined GDMPC. Recently, she requested a loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to buy feeds and piglets to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena, 38 years of age, is married and they are blessed with three children. She has been involved in the vegetable-vending business for almost 2 years. With this business she's earning a net income of 200 PHP daily. She then decided to request a loan amounting to 8,000 PHP to purchase string beans, squash, egg plant, and tomatoes to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow to become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase string beans, squash, egg plant, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Muniskhon

texts.ru: Мунисхон любимая мать 3 совершеннолетних детей и хранительница очага своего дома. Мунисхону 44 года. Она замужем и ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Тяжёлое экономическое положение семьи заставило ее мужа стать трудовым мигрантом и подрабатывать в чужбине. Мунисхон справляется с домохозяйством сама. Она более 4 лет занимается бизнесом. Она начала свой бизнес купле продажей женского белья, и данное время занимается купле продажей детской одежды, так как спрос детской одежды больше чем женского белья. Мунисхон введет бизнес сама и является основной кормилицей в семье. Она тратит все свои деньги для покупки продуктов питания. Ее сын тоже не имеет постоянное место работы и хочет ехать к отцу и там зарабатывать на жизнь, так как ее сын женат и имеет свою семью. Мунисхон не имеет денег для того, чтобы купить авиабилет и отправить сына в Российскую Федерацию. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muniskhon is the beloved mother of three grown children and a homemaker. She is 44 years old. She is married; her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Difficult economic conditions forced her husband to become a migrant worker and earn a living abroad. Muniskhon takes care of the household on her own. She has operated a business for over four years. She began her business selling women's clothing, and now sells children's clothing, as the demand for it is greater than for women's. Muniskhon runs the business herself, and is the sole provider for the family. She spends all her money on food products. Her son does not have a stable job, and wants to join his father in going abroad to earn a living, since he is married and has his own family. Muniskhon does not have the money to buy an airplane ticket and send her son to Russia. She is asking for a 2000 somoni loan. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy an airplane ticket for her son who wants to go to Russia

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a widow with three children. She is 33 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.

Elsa is a farmer and manages coconut production to earn a living. She also plants corn and root crops to sell. She requests a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Elsa has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, she hopes her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre soltero de 29 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos 2 hombre y 2 mujeres  en la Colonia Chuatraz, zona 2 Barrio el Calvario Sololá, Sololá. 
El se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando lechuga cerca de su vivienda, este trabajo  lo aprendió  junto a su padre desde que era pequeño, ahora lleva 8 años de realizar este tipo de actividad, ya que esta clase de cultivo mantiene su precio en el mercado teniendo mejores ganancias con las cuales cubre todos los gastos de su familia. 
De esta manera ve la necesidad de invertir para mejorar sus ingresos y ganancias por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para comprar pilones (plantas pequeñas) de lechuga y abono orgánico para luego cultivarlo. 
Entre sus sueños está construir un invernadero para su cultivo, mediante las ganancias que obtiene en lo que realiza.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 29-year-old single man.  He lives with his 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls in Colonia Chuatraz in zone 2 of the Barrio el Calvario Sololá in Sololá.  He makes a living in agriculture, cultivating lettuce near his home.  He learned this work with his father when he was little.  He has been doing this kind of activity for 8 years now since this type of crop maintains its price on the market and he has better earnings with which he covers all of the family expenses.

In this fashion he sees the need to invest in order to improve his revenue and profit and therefore he is requesting a loan of 5,500.00 quetzales (GTQ) to buy small lettuce plants and organic fertilizer to then cultivate the plants.

Among his dreams is to build a greenhouse for his crop by means of the profit that he obtains from what he is doing.

loans.use: to buy small lettuce plants and organic fertilizer.
